exercises.question: What does 'AOB' stand for in a meeting agenda?
In minute-taking, what is a 'seconder'?
options: The second person to arrive at the meeting.
A person who formally supports a motion or proposal.
A person who only attends the second half of the meeting.

exercises.question: John said: 'We should definitely hire more staff.' (John suggested...)
Sarah said: 'Please finish the report by 5 PM.' (Sarah urged...)
exercises.answer: Sarah urged the team to finish the report by 5 PM.

exercises.question: What is the minimum number of members required to make a meeting valid?

exercises.title: Action Item Follow-up
exercises.description: You are chasing an action item from last week's meeting. David was supposed to send the budget draft by Tuesday, but it is now Thursday. Write a polite but firm email to David. Use at least one reported speech structure.
exercises.sampleAnswer:
Subject: Follow-up: Action Item - Budget Draft

Hi David,

I hope you're having a productive week.

I'm following up on the action item from our last meeting on Monday. During the session, you agreed to send over the initial budget draft by Tuesday EOD.

As we discussed, the Chair pointed out that we need this draft to finalise the Q4 planning. Could you please let me know when we can expect to receive the file?

If there are any blockers I can help with, please do let me know.

Kind regards,

[Your Name]

dialogue.speaker: Chair
dialogue.text: Are there any matters arising from the previous minutes?

dialogue.speaker: Linda
dialogue.text: Yes, on page 2, it says the project was postponed, but it was actually just tabled until the next budget review.

dialogue.speaker: Chair
dialogue.text: Thank you, Linda. We will amend the record. Can I have a proposer and a seconder to approve the minutes as amended?

questions.question: What was the error in the minutes?
options: A project status was incorrectly recorded
